feed.title: SAP Community - SAP BW/4HANA
feed.subtitle: SAP BW/4HANA Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: BW4Hana issue on parallel run on hana runtime
entry.content:
Hello Expert !

I've noticed some strange behavior . We are currently working with BW4Hana. When we use hana runtime and we use it with parallel processing it seems that on some occasion the results are not as expected. 

Sometimes it happens to AMDP sometimes it happens to ABAP (yes we can run ABAP on hana runtime) that when we use parallel processing the results are not the same for example read tables retrieves wrong value.
As soon as I remove the option parallel run  the issue gets solved.

 

I am thinking maybe sometimes the issue comes from that the internal tables are declared globally but I am not sure actually what it really is and I could not find note about. 

Have you had the same experience ? What was the solution for you ? Have you found any note that helped ? Thanks

entry.title: SAP BW/4HANA Data Mart ADSO with multiple data loads
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

What happens when new records are loaded into a SAP BW/4HANA Data Mart ADSO where the characteristic fields match one or multiple records in the Data Mart ADSO except for the key figure(s)? Are the records overwritten or just appended to the data mart?

Thanks.

Mark

entry.title: End-to-End Data Modeling Architecture in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
üöÄEnd-to-End Data Modeling Architecture in SAP Datasphere

üìåBy Uday Kiran Munnangi

üîçIntroduction

As organizations modernize their data landscapes, the need for a unified, governed, and scalable data architecture becomes critical. In this blog, I‚Äôm excited to share a comprehensive end-to-end architecture I‚Äôve designed using SAP Datasphere ‚Äî showcasing how data flows from SAP source systems to analytics tools in a seamless, secure, and business-ready manner.

 

 

üß† Why SAP Datasphere?

SAP Datasphere acts as the central data fabric for integrating, modeling, securing, and exposing data across hybrid SAP environments. It enables both technical and business users to collaborate on trusted data models without duplicating or moving data unnecessarily.

üèóÔ∏è Core Components of SAP Datasphere

üîπData Builder ‚Äì The Technical Modeling Layer

  • Create Remote Tables via federation (no replication needed)
  • Build Tables and Views for transformation logic
  • Use Intelligent Lookup to enrich relationships
  • Apply Data Access Control (DAC) for secure, role-based access

üîπBusiness Builder ‚Äì The Semantic Layer

  • Define Facts (e.g., revenue, quantity)
  • Model Dimensions (e.g., customer, region)
  • Add Texts and Hierarchies for drill-down and multilingual support
  • Output Reusable Analytic Models for consumption across tools

üåêSource System Integration

üî∏On-Premise SAP Systems

System Connection Type Adapter Used

SAP S/4HANA (on-prem)DPA + Cloud ConnectorABAP Adapter
SAP ECCDPA + Cloud ConnectorABAP Adapter
SAP BW/4HANADPA + Cloud ConnectorHANA Adapter
SAP HANA (on-prem)DPA onlyHANA Adapter
  • ‚úÖData Provisioning Agent (DPA) enables federation and replication
  • ‚úÖSAP Cloud Connector ensures secure tunnel communication

üî∏Cloud SAP Systems

System Connection Type Authentication

SAP S/4HANA CloudHTTPS (API-based)OAuth 2.0
SAP SuccessFactorsHTTPS (OData v2)OAuth 2.0 / SAML
SAP AribaHTTPS (SOAP/OData APIs)API Token / OAuth

üìäFront-End Consumption Tools

Once modeled, data can be consumed by a wide range of analytics and planning tools:

  • üî∑SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) ‚Äì Live dashboards and stories
  • üî∂SAC for Planning ‚Äì Planning-enabled models via OData
  • üî∏Microsoft Analysis for Office ‚Äì Excel-based live reporting
  • üü° Power BI, Tableau, and others ‚Äì via ODBC/JDBC

üß© Additional Features That Matter

  • Space Management ‚Äì Logical separation of projects and teams
  • Catalog & Data Marketplace ‚Äì Discover and reuse trusted data assets
  • Connections Panel ‚Äì Centralized control over all source system links

‚úÖWhy This Architecture Matters

  • Simplifies SAP data integration across hybrid landscapes
  • Delivers business-context-ready models
  • Reduces reliance on complex ETL pipelines
  • Ensures governed, secure, and reusable data
  • Enables real-time analytics and planning

üì£Final Thoughts

This architecture is designed to help enterprises unlock the full potential of their SAP data ‚Äî with agility, governance, and scalability at its core.

If you found this helpful or have questions, feel free to comment or connect with me. Let‚Äôs keep learning and building together!

üîñ#SAPDatasphere #SAPBTP #SAPAnalyticsCloud #DPAgent #PowerBI #DataIntegration #BW4HANA #S4HANA #DataModeling #SAPCloud #Analytics #UdayKiranMunnangi

entry.title: Missing possibility to filter the language in the infoobject text maintenance
entry.content:
Recently we updated our BW to BW2023 in our company. I like using the web cockpit in BW4 as it is the pushed UI to use for managing infobjects and infoproviders. But one thing is really bugging me and even in the newest version of BW it is not possible: Filtering the language of texts in the master data maintenance is not possible. It seems like such a basic feature. Why is language not a standard filter or at least available as an additional filter?
If you have a customer owned Infoobject and are maintaining texts via web cockpit, it would be very useful to filter language. This would make it very easy to spot missing translations in a specifc language or to copy/paste texts of a specific language.

Is this a customizing issue in our system or just a missing feature? I'd put a request in the customer influence plattform, but unfortunately there is none for SAP BW.

entry.title: Unable to find SAP HANA information model when checking infocube - BPC Embedded | BW4/HANA | RTC
entry.content:
Hello experts.

Some advices  would be highly appreciated here üòä

I have an infocube in preprod that is not passing the check, please look below screenshot : 

It is based on an SAP HANA model. The issue does not exists in dev and qual environment (this is preprod).

BW version is 7.5 and Hana is 2.0. We are running RTC.

I've tried a reactivation and it does not regenerate the Hana "missing object".

Running the report : RSDDB_LOGINDEX_CREATE (SE38) results in this : 

Trying to read the cube from AFO provides this : 

It is also possible to get in some logs : 

(of course this cube state triggers lots of others errors when trying to run IC elimination, run some planning sequence, and so on ... seems the heart of all those issue is this cube failing the check)

Any ideas about a solution or additional tracks of investigations are very welcome.

Thanks in advance and regards.

Guillaume P.

entry.title: In SAP Learning Hub, is BDC, SAC, Datasphere, S/4HANA, or BW/4HANA available?
entry.content:
I know that there's a trial version of BDC, and it appears to have the following components.

SAC
Datasphere
SAP Databricks
S/4HANA Private Edition 

However, they appear to be restricted.

In the SAP Learning Hub, would any of these be available on?

SAC
Datasphere
SAP Databricks
S/4HANA Private Edition 
BW/4HANA Private Edition

If not, how do I make a recommendation to add it to the SAP Learning Hub?

Thanks!

Regards,

Mel Calucin

entry.title: Package and transport assignment after DataSource replication (BW/4HANA)
entry.content:
Hello,

when I replicate and activate a datasource in my BW-system there ist no package and no transport assignment. At the moment I do the assignment manually. Is there a way to get an automatic pop-up for the assignment like we have for all the other objects in BW-system?

I am using a BW/4HANA 2021 system and working in the SAP HANA Studio (Eclipse).

Thanks!

entry.title: Migration from 0UC_ISU_24 to Recommended Alternatives ‚Äì Missing Fields Issue
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm currently working on migrating SAP IS-U DataSources to a BW/4HANA environment. The existing system is still running on BW on HANA. SAP provides a whitelist indicating which DataSources are considered obsolete and recommends suitable alternatives for BW/4HANA.

In our case, the DataSource 0UC_ISU_24 is actively used and business-critical. According to SAP‚Äôs guidance, the suggested replacements are 0UCCONTRACT_ATTR_2 and 0UCCONTRACTH_ATTR_2. However, we're running into a major issue: the recommended alternatives do not cover all the required fields. A significant number of fields are missing.

This seems to stem from the fact that 0UC_ISU_24 is based on a complex IS-U function module which pulls data from multiple tables, whereas the recommended replacements are far less comprehensive.

So here‚Äôs my question:
Has anyone dealt with this migration before and found a working solution?

  • Did you somehow reuse or copy the original extractor logic (e.g., Z-copy of the FM)?

  • Or is there another approach you'd recommend for getting all the necessary data into BW/4HANA?

Any experience, suggestion or direction would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Hi Experts,i need to see infoobjects attributes ? Which table shows this information.
entry.content: Hi Experts,i need to see infoobjects attributes and dependencies in bw/4Hana  ? Which table shows this information.

entry.title: RSA5 extractor activation transport error "local workbench request only" . It is not saved in $TMP
entry.content: I want to transport the activation of an extractor in an TO, the package in which it is saved is transportable and has the ZQAS transport layer assigned, so, under normal conditions, any object saved in this package could be transported to QAS. But when I save the activation in an Transportation Order  it only allows me to save it in a local workbench order, how to enable it so that it can be transported to SAP quality.

entry.title: Power BI using SAP BW Application Server
entry.content:
Hello,

I‚Äôm looking for some hands-on experiences and advice regarding connecting Power BI to SAP BW/4HANA using the SAP BW Application Server connector.

I have tested both Direct Query and Import options, but the performance is extremely poor:

  • Expanding the data model takes ~7 minutes

  • Selecting the query adds another ~8 minutes

  • Only after entering prompts, it takes an additional ~1 minute before I can even start building the report

This makes the development workflow almost unusable.

My questions are:

  1. Is this normal behaviour when using Power BI with SAP BW/4HANA via Application Server connectivity?

  2. Could this be related to configuration settings on the BW side or Power BI side? I‚Äôm testing a connection between Power BI Desktop and SAP BW/4HANA  which is on cloud. 

  3. Have you found better performance with Direct Query vs. Import?

I‚Äôd really appreciate any real-world experiences or best practices to understand whether this is a configuration issue on our side or simply a limitation of the connector.

Thanks in advance!

Cristina

entry.title: S/4HANA CDS View with CDC enabled
entry.content:
Hello!

I have a question regarding CDC logging tables being shared by both SLT and ODP subscribers.

Currently we are testing this functionality in QA system and the changes are captured as expected.

One issue we see is that same Subscriber logging table is being consumed by both SLT and ODP subscribers and I would like to know if this is a normal behaviour.

Our QA system had a copy of Production recently and it shows the subscribers from Prod of SLT sharing the same logging table as the ODP subscriber. Because of this, the logging tables are getting piled up and not cleaned up automatically after the records are consumed by target system via CDS View. The SLT subscribers were present before the CDS view was created.

Will this be a problem when we deploy this CDS view and subscription in production?

In every article around and even SAP has mentioned that the Subscriber logging tables are unique per subscriber but it doesn‚Äôt seem so with what we see in QA.

If that‚Äôs the case shouldn‚Äôt there be a new logging table for CDS view when the CDS subscription was created?

Highly appreciate your response in this! Thank you.

entry.title: Regarding BW Usage Statistics Table In BW or BW4HANA
entry.content:
So, I need BW Object Usage Statistic Report so my question is simple do we have any table in BW or BW4HANA for that.
Now, From usage statistics I mean if I've 10 ADSO then what is its last use timestamp, Last changed by User, how much Content it holds, last load (Content TimeStamp ) , etc ect. 
same for like query, cube, datasource, process chain and all, so do we have anyy log files for this or we just have to go through each and every object for that.

Thank you.

entry.title: RSB4HTRF - Transfer of scenarios - Do we run it directly in Production?
entry.content:
Hello team,  

We are starting our movement from BW 7.5 (On HANA) to BW/4HANA. So far so good, we used transaction RSB4HTRF (In-place) in Sandbox to migrate couple scenarios with success, including the data was there with no problem.

I found some old discussions, stating we need to execute the transaction RSB4HTRF in each system (Dev, QA and Prod). I could not find a way to transport the process itself and not only the objects converted, which I believe will just clean up our production system.

Please, anyone did In-place migration and had experience on this part?

Thank you,

Marcelo

entry.title: BW/4 Inplace Conversion - Precheck warning - Query with SAP-Exit Variable - adjustment needed or not
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

we are currently performing the pre-checks for a BW/4HANA inplace conversion. During this process, a large number of queries are listed that use the SAP-Exit function modules of certain variables e.g. 0S_RQMRC  or 0PVAEX.

We know that 0PVAEX has a new BW/4 variable and needs to be adjusted and 0S_RQMRC is obsolete a long time ago..

The question is: Do we need to adjust these manually before switching to the B4H mode (as it is listed in the pre-.check) as the switch will be "blocked" otherwise or can we switch to the B4H mode and even convert system completely to BW/4  (assuming that the queries will no longer run if not adjusted - but adjustment then is possible in BW/4).

Thanks for clarifying.  The SAP notes are not clear on that part (at least not for me).

Best regards
Axel

entry.title: data source /US4G/0UC_MEMIDOC in S/4HANA for utilities
entry.content:
hi guys,

any experience with datasource /US4G/0UC_MEMIDOC in S/4HANA? It is activated from content, properly switched to ODP and delivers results in the source system via transaction RSA3. However, it can not be replicated in BW/4HANA, i.e., it appears not in the replication list.

Any idea how to replicate it?

Thanks!

entry.title: CDS view based CDC enabled Extractor is not working on ANLC
entry.content:
Hi Team,

In order to build a CDC enabled CDS View-based Data Extractor for ANLC table we have tried the following approaches but failed.
Is there any way available to build this, please guide?
Also, why there is such restrictions in place for enabling delta extractions?

  1. Building the CDS view on ANLC Table. It does not work. The data extraction/data pre-view also does not work. We checked few blogs and tried our luck on the view faav_anlc.
  2. Building the CDS view on faav_anlc view. The data extraction works only in full mode. The delta mode of extraction does not work with "delta.changeDataCapture.automatic : true". So, we tried with manually defining the elements.
  3. Building the CDS view by manually defining the delta elements. Using this the delta extraction fails because the view - faav_anlc has AMDP table functions and CDC does not support that.

entry.title: Range Partitioning for BW Table
entry.content:
We need to apply range partitioning for BW table .

Please let us know if it is possible and recommended to do manual partitioning for BW tables.

entry.title: BW/4HANA connection to SuccessFactors using Compoundemployee soap API instead Odata API
entry.content:
Hello Team,

W want use Compoundemployee soap API instead Odata API instead of SF Odata API to connect BW/4HANA to SuccessFactors using the DP agent.

the reason is : OdataAdapter required for SF Odata API is not supported any more to run on the DP agent and it has to run in DP server in SAP HANA Database. meantime the direct connection from SAP HANA DB to SF is not allowed and it has to be through DP agent installed in a separate machine.

the DP agent , we can use SoapAdapter and use Compoundemployee Soap API instead to extract data from SF to BW/4HANA.

Appreciate your confirmation if we can use Soap API instead of OData API please  to connect BW/4HANA to SuccessFactors through SAP Data Provisioning Agent

entry.title: Probleme SU01 Berechtigungen
entry.content:
Hallo zusammen,

folgende Situation:

Die Techniker in meinem Team sollen die SU01 nutzen k√∂nnen. Sie sollen dabei 03 Aktivit√§t haben und in bestimmten F√§llen, z. B. f√ºr die Erstellung eines RFC Users, d√ºrfen sie die 02 Aktivit√§t haben.

Nun habe ich zum Test eine Rolle erstellt, die im Men√º nur die Transaktion SU01 hat. Die dabei generierten Berechtigungen habe ich zum Testen erstmal alle auf Aktivit√§t 03 gesetzt und bestimmte Berechtigungen wie z. B. f√ºr HR gel√∂scht/deaktiviert. Au√üerdem habe ich in der Berechtigung S_USER_GRP ausschlie√ülich die User Gruppe f√ºr RFC User hinzugef√ºgt.

Als ich die Rolle testen wollte, hatte ich dennoch vollen Zugriff auf die SU01 und konnte auch jede andere Usergruppe bearbeiten. Die Transaktion SU01 zeigt mir innerhalb der Transaktion in einer Message-Box eine rote Error-Meldung an, dass mir die n√∂tigen Berechtigungen fehlen, um √Ñnderungen durchzuf√ºhren, jedoch kann ich es trotzdem machen.

Bisherige Tests:

‚Äì Ich habe meinem User alle Rollen nehmen lassen und nur diese Rolle f√ºr SU01 hinzuf√ºgen lassen. Ergebnis bleibt, dass ich bearbeiten kann.

‚Äì Mein User hat kein extra Profil oder SAP_ALL etc., nur das Profil, welches aus der Rolle f√ºr SU01 generiert wird.

-In der SU53 werden mir auch, korrekt, meine fehlenden Aktivit√§t wie die 02 in der Berechtigung S_USER_GRP angezeigt. Wie oben beschrieben kann ich dennoch bearbeiten.

-In der SUIM habe ich √ºber die komplexe Berechtigungsobjektsuche die Berechtigung S_USER_GRP mit der Aktivit√§t 02 gesucht und das System hat mir die Rolle angezeigt, die ich erstellt habe und die ausschlie√ülich die Aktivit√§t 03 hat.

Technische Details: Mein System ist ein BW System mit der Installierten Version SAP BW/4HANA 2021 SP/FP 08 03/2024

Ich hoffe nun das jemand von euch mir dabei helfen kann.
